column2: Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim]
[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned, carrying with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim]
Having returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] long travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] comes up to you and pulls out
Upon [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] return, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] hands me
[relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] [relic_hunter.GetFirstName] has finally returned from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, and has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim]
[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has returned and brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim]
The Weapon of the Ancients
Upon An Iron Horse
Upon An Iron Horse
The Sword of Stalin

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search, followed by two men who carry a heavy iron box, which they place on the floor before you. Bowing, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] proclaims: 'My search is concluded. I have brought home with me a terrifying weapon, an ancient firearm.'
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] a strange metal object. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it used to be a working device, which once was able to do calculations of hours in just a few seconds!

[GetArtifactSearchBegining] an unusual object with numbers on it. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it used to be a working device, which once was able to tell the time to its owner in some mysterious ways!
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] a heavy metal object. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it used to be a working device, which once was able to write perfect letters at incredible speed!
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] a long steel object. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] explains that it was made before the event and it can help its owner to see faraway places!
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] some musty books. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that every person used to learn from books like these in the Old World!
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] something looking like a compass, just much smaller. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] explains it is truely a compass, a compass remaining from the Old World!

[GetArtifactSearchBegining] a small iron box and a rusty coin inside it. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] has proof that it once was the currency of the legendary empire, the European Union! Perhaps it might bestow upon me some of the prosperity it once brought?

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search, calling you to your courtyard, where an imposing, richly detailed black and golden chariot stands proudly. Bowing, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] proclaims: 'My search is concluded. I have brought home with me a chariot of the ancients, an iron steed of a great king.'

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search, calling you to your courtyard, where an enormous, four-wheeled iron chariot stands proudly. Bowing, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] proclaims: 'My search is concluded. I have brought home with me a chariot of the ancients, an iron steed of a fearsome conqueror.'

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search, followed by two men who carry a heavy iron box, which they place on the floor before you. Bowing, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] proclaims: 'My search is concluded. I have brought home with me a terrifying weapon, the sword of Stalin himself.'
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] a strange skull. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] explains that this is a skull of an unknown ancient creature.
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] an astonishing weapon. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] proclaims it's the legendary Axe of Devendra.
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] an astonishing weapon. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] proclaims it's the legendary Vajrayudha.
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] an astonishing weapon. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] proclaims it's the legendary Varunastra.
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] an astonishing weapon. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] proclaims it's the legendary Agneyastra.
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] an astonishing weapon. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] proclaims it's the legendary Suryastra.
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] an astonishing weapon. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] proclaims it's the legendary Ghaznivinashakastra.
[GetArtifactSearchBegining] an astonishing weapon. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] proclaims it's the legendary Sword of Attila, the one which he punished the Romans countless times.
Vajrayudha
Varunastra
Agneyastra
Suryastra
Ghaznivinashakastra
Sword of Attila

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search, followed by holding a small, sealed iron box in his hands, shaking ever so slightly. Bowing, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] proclaims: 'My search is concluded. I have brought home with me the Heart of Marat.'
Old World Glass
Glassware from the ancient world, finer than anything modern glassblowers can produce.
Old World Jewelery
Jewelery from the ancient world, more intricate than anything modern artisans can produce.
Old World Money
Icons of the Almighty Dollar.
Old World Music Box
An ancient, shiny device that contains the melodies of the Old World.
Old World Machinery
A fabulously preserved piece of Old World machinery, constructed of a miraculous metal and blessed so that it shall never rust.
The Sword of Michael

Left behind by Archangel Michael after the Great Tribulation, this golden sword is said to have originated in God's armory. It would be blasphemy of the highest order to shed human blood with it, but as a ceremonial relic it proves divine right to rule.
The Horn of Gabriel
The gleaming horn of the Archangel Gabriel, sounded to devastating effect at the onset of the Great Tribulation and left behind on Earth in preparation for the final doom that must eventually follow.
Right Hand of Petrus Romanus

The mummified hand of Petrus Romanus, grasping the gavel of the dreadful judge. Although Petrus Romanus was destroyed when he placed his hand upon the gavel, humanity was spared and the final judgment postponed.
Papal Tiara

This elaborate, jewel-encrusted crown was used by the antediluvian Catholic Church in their coronation ceremonies. It was rumored that a papal tiara was sent to Washington for safekeeping before the Deluge. These rumors have been confirmed.
Ancient Rosary
This row of beads is used by devotees of the Virgin Mary to ensure that prayers are said in the proper order. This particular chain of beads is several centuries old.
Excalibur
This legendary sword was wielded by the great King Arthur himself during his campaigns in Britain and beyond. It was once thought lost to time, but it has once again found a worthy bearer.
Silver Key
A simple silver key.\nIt MUST NEVER be used.
The Black Slab
A black granite tablet engraved with a timeless warning:\n"Do not call up that which you cannot put down."
Golden Menorah
A large seven-branched menorah made of solid gold. It closely matches surviving descriptions of the menorah that once resided in the Holy Temple.
Jewish Banner

A white banner, adorned with a blue Star of David and flanked by two blue stripes. Although simple in design, it is nevertheless capable of inspiring Jewish warriors to fight bravely on the field of battle.
Ancient Sefer Torah

This handwritten Torah scroll, containing all 304,805 letters of the Hebrew Torah, was copied onto parchment long before the Event occurred. Pre-Event Sifrei Torah are highly sought after by Jewish religious and historical scholars alike.
Finger of a Rabbi
This little bone is said to have come from an incredibly wise and knowledgeable rabbi.
Stone of Golgotha
This ordinary-looking piece of limestone is said to be the very stone upon which the Holy Cross was raised during Jesus's execution.
Arm of Light

The sword originally wielded by an ancient yet unknown Pre-Event Irish hero, the Arm of Light has been used to slay numerous servants of the demonic Queen of Britannia. It has since become a symbol of Irish independence and the eternal struggle against the perfidious Anglo.
Heart of the Revolution

Marat was the sole begotten son of Madame Guilottine and an alchemist, who lived on Earth centuries before the Event. However, his flesh was dying from the moment he was born, for his mortal, human body could not contain his divine essence. His heart is the only part that remained of him on Earth, after he shed his human form and ascended to Godhood, joining his mother. Some believe that it was Him, not Madame herself that guided the Great Prophet Robespierre.
Broken Mechanism

This ancient wooden box houses a large amount of metal and glass fragments of various shapes and sizes. While it supposedly was once an astrological device, it can now only really serve as a fancy paperweight.
Clockwork Astronomical Calendar
This rather complex mechanism is composed of dozens of gears housed in a sturdy metal box. It can be used to predict astronomical positions and eclipses for calendar and astrological purposes.
Bladbraekyr

The Legendary Bladbraekyr has many names, known to the Al-Said family as Shamshir Al-Zinjibar. This Sword and Dagger mate date long before the event, and the materials of its creation is to thank for the longevity. Peerlessly crafted Damascus steel blades affixed to ivory pommels with a powerful and durable golden metal crossguard. The storied history of this sword earned its most well known name in the battle against the Paladins of Charlemange, the ancient knight Esclabor met Roland in single combat, there, the blade shattered Durandal and left Roland mangled and laid low by the might of the newly named Bladbraekyr.
Relic Handgon
An ancient handgon from before the event, whole hosts of men did battle with these as their primary weapon, and with them they conquered every part of the known world.
Officer's Handgon
As much of a ceremony piece as a weapon, this compact handgon was a status symbol of the elite in the pre-event army. Though that doesnt mean it wasnt any less dangerous.
Rare Relic Handgon
Uncommon compared to other pre-event handgons found, it has apparent an entirely different design and structure, perhaps denoting a different origin. Yet all the same it was a powerful weapon.
Officer Jewellery

The Officers of the pre-event were numerous, it's hard to believe so many young noblemen were available to form the backbone of a force able to conquer so much. Their icons are something to respect, both in deed and design.
Relic Firework

This device here from the pre-event is shrouded in mystery, some argue it was a festival device used to celebrate various occasions. Others have raised up claims it was a weapon of war, in any case, it is a rare find.
Antedeluvian Helm
This armor piece from the ancient Amriqi is a provocative design, unrestrictive and rather exposing, one wonders if they had found the perfect balance of armored and light infantry.
Relic Dagger
This dagger was a standard issue amongst the Men-at-Arms of the Amriqi, alongside the handgon it made for a well rounded warrior able to fight at multiple ranges effectively.
Relic Sword
A Mamluk design, with engravings lost to sand and time. This was the mark of an ancient officer, the prestige it carries are known by allies and the bite it gives is felt by the foe.
Relic Armour

This armour is a combination of a local design and materials with antedeluvian plates extracted from chariots. It is the perfect combination of these two materials to produce an excellent suit of armour.
Sword of Attila
This is the legendary Sword of Attila, also known as the Sword of God and the Sword of Mars.
Skull of a Tzar
A skull of an ancient member of Romanov dynasty, believed to reside in Heaven now.
Hand of a Tzar
A hand of an ancient member of Romanov dynasty, believed to reside in Heaven now.
Arm of a Tzar
An arm of an ancient member of Romanov dynasty, believed to reside in Heaven now.
Foot of a Tzar
A foot of an ancient member of Romanov dynasty, believed to reside in Heaven now.
Tzar Blood
A handkerchief with blood of martyred Tzar Alexander II, murdered by organisation "Narodnaya Volya", believed to be progenitors of modern Stalinist church
The Black Sword

The ancestral sword of the Tsoy Dynasty, said to have slain many foes in combat in the hands of Leonid Tsoy, the Restorer of Il San. the black sheen of the weapon terrifies those who stand against it even today.
Antideluvian Gold Bar
An antideluvian gold bar discovered in the ruins of an ancient city, it is worth both it's value in gold and value in age to collectors. It can be quite prestigious to own.
Antideluvian Pottery
Pottery produced before the apocolypse is generally of higher quality and easier to clean meaning that using it can prevent disease.
Antideluvian Disc
This Disc is believed to somehow contain thoughts and knowledge however the means by which this is accomplished is largely a mystery.
Antideluvian Silver Bar
An antideluvian silver bar discovered in the ruins of an ancient city, it is worth both it's value in silver and value in age to collectors. It can be quite prestigious to own.
Durandal
The white blade of D'Artagnan will always help Numenor in their time of need. It's been restored to it's former glory, gaining it's owner a place of great renown in the Novel.
Sheath of Durandal
The Sheath of Durendal was sold by Aragorn Napoleon to Sinbad the Merchant. It was retrieved from a Merchant in a great Arabian city.
Pommel of Durandal
A great thief stole the pommel of D'Artagnan's blade, selling it to the Tzar. It was recovered from the ancient treasury of the Tzars.
The Hilt of Durandal
The Hilt of Durendal was hidden by Aragon Napoleon's descendant to be preserved. It was found in the catachombs of Notre Dame.
Blade of Durandal

The Blade of the Sword Durendal, the weapon forged for the Valar D'Artagnan by the titan Gargantua. Lost at the battle of Waterloo in the bowels of the Beast of Gevedaun, all Novelists pray to see it restored to its glory.
Sell Antideluvian Gold Bar
Sell an Antideluvian Gold Bar to local merchants for it's gold value and collector value.
Sell Antideluvian Silver Bar
Sell an Antideluvian Silver Bar to local merchants for it's silver value and collector value.
Reforge Durandal
Now that i have gathered all parts of the legendary blade it is time to reforge it.

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search, followed by holding a small, sealed iron box in his hands, shaking ever so slightly. Bowing, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] proclaims: 'My search is concluded. I have brought home with me an Antideluvian Gold Bar.

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search, followed by holding a small, sealed iron box in his hands, shaking ever so slightly. Bowing, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] proclaims: 'My search is concluded. I have brought home with me an Antideluvian Pottery.

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search, followed by holding a small, sealed iron box in his hands, shaking ever so slightly. Bowing, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] proclaims: 'My search is concluded. I have brought home with me an Antideluvian Record.

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] search, followed by holding a small, sealed iron box in his hands, shaking ever so slightly. Bowing, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] proclaims: 'My search is concluded. I have brought home with me an Antideluvian Silver Bar.
Excellent! I'll pay for it.
Im not paying that! Not for some junk.
Lets donate it to the Dhakhira.
Excellent! I'll pay for it.
I cant afford to pay for that.
Lets donate it to the Dhakhira.

News from the excavation site! The diggers have uncovered a Relic Handgon from the sands. An ancient gon even more advanced than those from the Thunder Dragon itself. Now, the diggers must be paid for their discovery otherwise they will be forced to sell it to foreign merchants, unless you have another idea?

News from the excavation site! The diggers have uncovered a Officer's Handgon from the sands. A mostly ceremonial weapon used by the noble officers of old Al-Sunta'kum, however it was still just as deadly a gon as it's larger cousins. Now, the diggers must be paid for their discovery otherwise they will be forced to sell it to foreign merchants, unless you have another idea?

News from the excavation site! The diggers have uncovered a very rare style of Handgon from the sands. Seemingly designed for a completely different purpose to the other large Handgons we have uncovered, its method of usage is still yet unknown. Now, the diggers must be paid for their discovery otherwise they will be forced to sell it to foreign merchants, unless you have another idea?

News from the excavation site! The diggers have uncovered Officer's Jewellery from the sands. These were a type of jewellery worn by the officer's of their armies to signify their power over their inferiors. Now, the diggers must be paid for their discovery otherwise they will be forced to sell it to foreign merchants, unless you have another idea?

News from the excavation site! The diggers have uncovered a relic firework from the sands. It is believed that these were used for festivals in the antedeluvian age, though some believe they were used for war. Now, the diggers must be paid for their discovery otherwise they will be forced to sell it to foreign merchants, unless you have another idea?

News from the excavation site! The diggers have uncovered a antedeluvian helmet from the sands. Believed to have been widely used by the ancient legionaries of AL-Sunta'kum it is strangely open and visorless. Now, the diggers must be paid for their discovery otherwise they will be forced to sell it to foreign merchants, unless you have another idea?

News from the excavation site! The diggers have uncovered a relic dagger from the sands. Believed to have been carried by all amriqi legionaries in the antedeluvian age to supplement their gons, it has been repaired and is usable once more. Now, the diggers must be paid for their discovery and the price of repairs otherwise they will be forced to sell it to foreign merchants, unless you have another idea?

News from the excavation site! The diggers have uncovered a relic sword sword from the sands. Made in the mamluk style it is believed that only the highest of nobles among the ancient amriqi were permitted to carry this blade,it has been repaired and is usable once more. Now, the diggers must be paid for their discovery and the price of repairs otherwise they will be forced to sell it to foreign merchants, unless you have another idea?

News from the forges! They have managed to create a wonderous design of armour which incorporates antedeluvian plates into it's design, it will provide a great deal of protection while also being moderately light. However the smiths will require payment for such a masterpiece, unless you have another idea?
Excellent! I'll pay for their work.
I'll take the artifact by force.
Let them leave.
News from your county! A group of peasants have found a Telescope buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.
News from your county! A group of peasants have found several textbooks buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.
News from your county! A group of peasants have found a Compass buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.
News from your county! A group of peasants have found a Typewriter buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.
News from your county! A group of peasants have found a Calculator buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.
News from your county! A group of peasants have found a Watch buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.
News from your county! A group of peasants have found a Record buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.
News from your county! A group of peasants have found Pottery buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.
News from your county! A group of peasants have found a Antideluvian Gold Bar buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.
News from your county! A group of peasants have found a Fire-Arm buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.

News from your county! A group of peasants have found a Teacup buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.
News from your county! A group of peasants have found a Teaset buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.
News from your county! A group of peasants have found a Antideluvian Silver Bar buried in the Tells. You can choose to either pay them for it, take it by force or let them leave.
Mona Lisa

This ancient painting depicts a woman with an enigmatic smile. Many men have wondered who she is, but all answers have been lost in the Event. For the Novelist, the painting might depict some lady of tales, and often claim her true name to be that of Beatrice from the Divine Comedy or Lucia from The Betrothed.
The Divine Comedy: Inferno

This text describes the adventures of italian poet Dante Alighieri through the Nine Circles of Hell. Accompanied by ancient poet Virgil, Dante experiences many eye-opening encounters that tell us about the time before the Event.
The Divine Comedy: Purgatorio

This text describes the adventures of italian poet Dante Alighieri through the Nine Circles of Purgatory. Accompanied by ancient poet Virgil, Dante experiences many eye-opening encounters that tell us about the time before the Event.
The Divine Comedy: Paradiso

This text describes the adventures of italian poet Dante Alighieri through the Heavenly Skies of Paradise. Accompanied by his lost beloved Beatrice, Dante experiences many eye-opening encounters and comes face to face with the Almighty Christian God. Novelists believe this actually rapresents Eru, the Author, and the few Italian Novelists often depict Eru with eagle-like wings.
I Promessi Sposi (The Betrothed)

This text describes the tale of italian betrothed Lorenzo Tramaglino and Lucia Mondella. The two try to marry despite the opposition of the dreadful spaniard lord Don Rodrigo, with the help of the wise Fra Cristoforo (identified by the Novelists as Gandalf the Grey).
Il Principe (The Prince)
Written by italian writer Niccolò Machiavelli, The Prince is a detailed guide for any noble that wishes to become a great ruler. Despite it's age, the book still enjoys great popularity.
The Fellowship of the Ring

This ancient text survived, ruined but still partially readable, the test of time. After the Event, the Novelist faith aknowledged the journey of the Hobbit to destroy the One Ring as a central part of the past history of the world.
The Two Towers

This ancient text survived, ruined but still partially readable, the test of time. After the Event, the Novelist faith aknowledged the journey of the Hobbit to destroy the One Ring as a central part of the past history of the world.
The Return of the King

This ancient poem survived, ruined but still readable, the test of time. After the Event, the Novelist faith considers the return of King Aragorn a key event in the history of the world, as important as the destruction of the One Ring.
The Fellowship of the Ring

Restoring an ancient text, the Novelist have pieced back together part of the Novel's plot. The book details the departure of Tintin, the Ringbearer, along with his companions, his meeting with Kuhjung Luke the Lucky, his encounter with Aragorn Napoleon Bonaparte, the formation of the Fellowship with Edmond Dantés, Asterix and the Pevensie Siblings, and the death of Edmond Dantés after his corruption from the power of the One Ring, the Fellowship breaking as a result.
The Two Towers

Restoring an ancient text, the Novelist have pieced back together part of the Novel's plot. The book details the adventure of Tintin and Samsagace Haddock to bring the Ring to Mount Vesuvius guided by Sméagol, as well as the tales of the rest of the Fellowship, traveling to try and save Meriadoc and Peppin from the forces of the Witcher King of Angmar, and their return in glory to Paris with the help of Gandalf the White.
The Return of the King

Restoring an ancient text, the Novelist have pieced back together part of the Novel's plot. The book details the final days of the Third Era, following the battles Aragorn Napoleon and his companions fought against the forces of Mordor, the prisony on Elba of the one true king, his meeting with the Fox of the Child of the Stars, and his return to power, as well as the last leg of Tintin's journey to throw the One Ring in the fires of Mount Vesuvius.
The Hobbit

This ancient text survived, ruined but still partially readable, the test of time. After the Event, the Novelist faith aknowledged the journey of the Dwarves and the lone Hobbit as a turning point for the past history of the world.
The Hobbit

Restoring an ancient text, the Novelist have pieced back together part of the Novel's plot. The book tells the adventure of Hobbit Bilbo and the company of the Dwarves led by Thorin Écu-de-chêne to Denmark, in pursuit of their ancient home stolen by the dragon Fafnir. On the way, the Hobbit happens to find the One Ring in the hands of Sméagol.
The Silmarillion

This ancient text survived, ruined but still partially readable, the test of time. After the Event, the Novelist faith integrated what was left of it in their faith, making it a key component of their faith.
The Silmarillion

Restoring an ancient text, the Novelist have pieced back together part of the Novel's plot. The book tells the tale of the writing of the world from Eru l'Auteur and the Valar, the betrayel of some of them, Sauron and the White Witch chief of all, the fight of the betrayers with Arslan and the loyal Valar, and many more ancient legends of the time.
The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe

This ancient text tells an adventure of the Novelist heroes known as Pevensies siblings in the land of Narnia, known to many as Ireland. Here they help the Novelist god Arslan fight the White Witch. Novelist scholars debate if the events of this book take place before or after the events of the Main Plot of the Novel.
Prince Caspian

The tale of a warrior named Caspian that, with the help of the Pevensie brothers, conquers the throne of Narnia. Novelist scholars claim the Prince might be a far lost descendant of the Caspian of the First Age, son of Lancelot and grandson of Charlemagne.
The Voyage of the Dawn Treader

In this book King Caspian, as well as some of the Pevensies, travel to find mysterious islands in the name of Narnia aboard the ship Dawn Treader. The Novelists identify some of the islands to be the same as the ones mentioned in Gulliver's Travel or Sindbad the Mariner's journeys.
The Silver Chair
In this book Edmund, cousin of the Pevensie siblings, along with his squire Jill Pole, travels to Narnia to help find King Caspian's son and his encounter with the treacherous White Witch.
The Horse and His Boy

A book telling of the escape of a Narnian boy named Shasta and his talking horse from the rulers of Calormen, that the Novelists identify as Britain. In his return to Ireland, Shasta is aided by Aravis, descendant of the great hero Aramis, as well as her talking horse.
The Magician's Nephew

A book detailing the birth of Narnia at the hands of Arslan and the arrival of the White Witch. Christians believe the book is an allegory to explain their Genesis to children, but Novelists claim the book is an actual retelling of the events of the creation of Ireland.
The Last Battle

This book tells the tale of the final days of Narnia. While Christians scholars believe it to be a retelling for children of the Apocalypse, Novelists scholars debate whether it's a prophecy of the end of the world or a retelling of the days of the Event.
Notre-Dame de Paris (The Hunchback of Notre-Dame)

The remaining fragments of this book, carefully pieced back together by Novelist scholars, detail the story of Quasimodo, the Hunchback bell-ringer of Notre-Dame, his love for the gipsy woman Esmeralda, and his saving of Gandalf from the hands of Bishop Frollo. Novelist scholars still hunt for integral copies that might better explain the history and ultimate fate of Esmeralda.
Les Trois Mousquetaires (The Three Musketeers)

This story set during the First Age, before the fall of the Southern Continent, tells the tale of the Three Musketeers of his majesty Charlemagne and their friendship with a young warrior, the Valar D'Artagnan in disguise. Together, the four live many adventures until ultimately D'Artagnan leaves, not before gifting to a young Roland the sword Durlindana, a copy of his own Durendal.
Les Misérables

A story that details the past of the Maiar Valjean and Javert. This story of redemption, hardships and faith is beloved by all Novelists, and the Jacobinist believe it emphasizes the glory of the Revolution and therefore of Madame Guillotine.
Le Petite Prince (The Little Prince)

The story of a meeting during the Fourth Age between a man that drives a machine called 'avion' and the Child of the Stars, a Valar disguised as a young kid. The story ends with the Valar's return to the stars. The book is most beloved among the Librarians.
20.000 Lieues sous les Mers (20.000 Leagues under the Seas)

A tale about the Valar Nemo, is magical vessel Nautilus and his meeting with many men of all kinds, who he introduces to the wonders and dangers of the deep sea. The riches and beauty described in it make it a particularly beloved book among city dwellers.
Dracula

The history of the battle against a descendant of the evil Maiar Dracula by the british hero Jonathan Harker and dutch Hero Abraham van Helsing. The tale ends with the noble sacrifice of Quincey Morris and the death of Dracula. It's considered unholy by the French, although many other cultures love it.
Frankenstein

The tale of the Monster of Frankenstein, a horrible creation that acts horrible vengeance upon his equally terrible creator, a servant of Sauron, as retold by the creator himself. The story is considered a cautionary tale by the Novelists, who consider reading it for pleasure a grave insult to the Valar themselves.
Le Fantôme de l'Opéra (The Phantom of the Opera)

The history of the assassin known as the Phantom of the Opera. This tale is a forbidden text among the Novelists, who consider the Phantom the killer of the courageous Prince Caspian. However, many French rulers have read it and appreciated it in secret, and Novelist assassins often wear a mask fashioned like the one in the book to celebrate the Phantom.
The Rime of the Ancient Mariner

A tale of a sailor and his terrifying adventure in the southern seas. The tale is a cautionary tale for all seafarers, and many Pirates believe that not showing respect to the creatures of the sea will incur the punishment of the ghost ship of Night-Mare Life-in-Death. As such, Albatross are considered holy birds among the pirates, and slaying one a bad omen.
Don Quijote de la Mancha

The adventure of the hidalgo Don Quijote, who travels the land fighting against imagined threats with his companion and squire Sancho Panza on the back of his horse Rocinante. Don Quijote's amusing lunacy makes the story very entertaining. The Novelists, however, claim Don Quijote was actually seeing visions of the past, and so remember him as a tragic hero.
Doctor Jekyll and Mister Hyde

The horrifying story of Doctor Jekyll and his transformation in the cruel Mister Hyde. The tale is well known among the British, even the peasantry, but the full book is still a rare finding that many British ruler would keep in high regard. The Novelists believe it to be a true story, and some of their more mystically inclined members have been known to search for the elixir created by Doctor Jekyll.
Die Verwandlung (The Metamorphosis)

The terrifying tale of the transformation of merchant Gregor Samsa into a monstrous bug and the breaking of his relation with his family is considered one of the scariest events of the old world among the Novelists, who fear the idea of waking one day as one such creature. It is said many of them have grown more considerate to others after reading this book.
